body:
Comment 5 by **andybons@chromium.org**: 
My unsolicited advice is to not target specific OSes/versions since it's likely that
this is also broken on some Android distros as well (it's a webkit issue, not an OS
one). That being said, there are many reliable ways to detect mobile safari.

Since this has bitten me as well (reading the spec on my iPad) I'm more than happy to
help. The top-level goal being that we find a solution that doesn't rely on browser
checks to work everywhere.

Let me know if you'd like me to start working on a patch.
